item.title: Second Strike Scrutiny Obscures Larger Question About Trump’s Boat Attacks
item.description: Congress is focusing on two deaths in one strike. But nine other people died in that same attack, and the United States has killed 87 in all. Were any of those killings legal?
item.dc:creator: Charlie Savage and Julian E. Barnes
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: Adm. Frank M. Bradley attended a classified meeting with lawmakers on Capitol Hill.

item.title: Boat Strike Video Shown to Lawmakers
item.description: Two survivors of the attack were said to struggle to cling to the boat before a second strike. After the briefing with lawmakers, the military disclosed a boat strike on Thursday that killed four people.
item.dc:creator: Helene Cooper, Megan Mineiro, Julian E. Barnes and Charlie Savage
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: Adm. Frank M. Bradley, left, and Gen. Dan Caine, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, at the Capitol on Thursday.

item.title: Takeaways From the Pentagon Investigation on Hegseth’s Use of Signal
item.description: The inspector general concluded that the defense secretary violated the Pentagon’s instructions on using a private electronic device to share sensitive information.
item.dc:creator: John Ismay
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.media:description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth in Washington this week. He declined to be interviewed by the inspector general’s office.

item.title: Supreme Court Clears Way for Texas Redistricting Maps Pushed by Trump
item.description: Texas officials had asked the court to allow the state to use the new maps in the midterm elections, part of a push by President Trump to gain a partisan advantage.
item.dc:creator: Abbie VanSickle
item.category: League of United Latin American Citizens
item.media:description: State Representative Matt Morgan, a Republican, holds a map of the new proposed congressional districts in Texas in August.

item.title: Florida Republicans Start Redistricting Talks, but Some Aren’t in a Rush
item.description: Redistricting talks in Florida got off to a slow start on Thursday, as state lawmakers grapple with political and legal questions amid internal power struggles.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Mazzei and Nick Corasaniti
item.media:description: Protesters outside the Florida Capitol building in Tallahassee. A House redistricting committee met for the first time on Thursday.

item.title: Grand Jury Said to Decline to Re-Indict Letitia James
item.description: After a judge dismissed the Trump administration’s first attempt to indict the attorney general of New York State, a new grand jury effort failed, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Devlin Barrett and Jonah E. Bromwich
item.category: New York State Criminal Case Against Trump (71543-23)
item.media:credit: Allison Robbert for The New York Times
item.media:description: Letitia James, New York’s attorney general, has long been in President Trump’s crosshairs.

item.title: Trump Trumpets Peace in Africa Amid War on Drug Boats, in Day of Dissonance
item.description: President Trump presided over a Congo-Rwanda peace deal on the same day his administration was being questioned about potential war crimes.
item.dc:creator: Shawn McCreesh
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
item.media:description: President Trump trumpeted a peace agreement while hosting President Paul Kagame of Rwanda and President Felix Tshisekedi of the Democratic Republic of Congo in Washington on Thursday.

item.title: Trump Switches Architects for White House Ballroom Project
item.description: The president had clashed with the original designer and insisted on increasing the size and scope of the ballroom on a short timeline.
item.dc:creator: Erica L. Green
item.media:description: The demolition of the East Wing of the White House in October.

item.title: Days After Trump Pardoned One Honduran Politician, Another Gets 22 Years
item.description: President Trump pardoned the former Honduran president, who had been convicted for drug trafficking. Midence Oqueli Martinez Turcios, a former congressman, got nearly 22 years.
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Weiser and Santul Nerkar
item.media:description: Midence Oqueli Martinez Turcios led heavily armed teams as they transported cocaine from clandestine airstrips.

item.title: Warner Bros. Discovery and Netflix Said to Be in Exclusive Talks
item.description: Netflix would acquire Warner television and film studios as well as HBO Max in a deal that would bulk up the world’s biggest paid streaming service.
item.dc:creator: Brooks Barnes
item.media:description: Netflix headquarters in Los Gatos, Calif.

item.title: Best TV Shows of 2025
item.description: Many of the year’s best series seemed to be in conversation with one another, including “Severance,” “The Pitt,” “Andor,” “Pluribus,” “The Lowdown” and others.
item.dc:creator: James Poniewozik and Mike Hale

item.title: Her Roof Was About to Be Fixed. Then Immigration Agents Showed Up.
item.description: The Trump administration’s deportation agenda is reverberating beyond immigrant communities as agents begin fanning out around New Orleans.
item.dc:creator: Eduardo Medina
item.media:description: The agents, including several from the Border Patrol, had shown up and tried to detain the men, but they refused to get down from the roof.

item.title: ICE Separates Boy, 6, From Father During Effort to Deport Them to China
item.description: The child and his father fled China earlier this year and the boy had just been enrolled in school. Federal officials have tried and failed to send them back.
item.dc:creator: Ana Ley and Hamed Aleaziz

item.title: Tim Walz Calls Trump’s Tirade Against Somalis in Minnesota ‘Vile’
item.description: Minnesota’s governor said the president’s xenophobic remarks were dangerous as the state continued to face fiscal questions about a fraud scandal.
item.dc:creator: Ernesto Londoño
item.media:description: Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota during an appearance in Washington in June.

item.title: As Trump Covets Nobel Peace Prize, FIFA Cozies Up to Him With Its Own Award
item.description: Gianni Infantino, head of soccer’s governing body, has been ingratiating himself with the president to help ensure a successful 2026 World Cup.
item.dc:creator: Tariq Panja and Luke Broadwater
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts
item.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross/The New York Times
item.media:description: President Trump, holding a replica of the men’s World Cup, with Gianni Infantino, the president of FIFA, in the Oval Office in August. Mr. Trump later asked to keep the trophy.

item.title: Trump’s Relationship With the President of FIFA
item.description: Gianni Infantino, head of soccer’s governing body, FIFA, has lauded President Trump at almost every opportunity, even starting a FIFA Peace Prize after Mr. Trump didn’t win the Nobel. Luke Broadwater, a White House reporter, describes the bromance.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater, Karen Hanley and James Surdam

item.title: On Pope Leo’s Visit to Lebanon and Turkey, A.I. Was a Frequent Concern
item.description: On his first trip as pontiff, Leo XIV predictably called for peace and unity. But he also addressed technology’s promise and pitfalls.
item.dc:creator: Motoko Rich
item.media:credit: Diego Ibarra Sanchez for The New York Times
item.media:description: Pope Leo in Bkerke, Lebanon, on Monday. During his six-day tour, he called out the risks of artificial intelligence and other rapidly advancing technologies.

item.title: Meta Weighs Cuts to Its Metaverse Unit
item.description: Meta plans to direct its investments to focus on wearables like its augmented reality glasses but does not plan to abandon building the metaverse.
item.dc:creator: Mike Isaac
item.media:description: Meta’s virtual reality headset last year. The company’s augmented reality glasses have become a surprise hit.

item.title: Macron Urges Xi to Help End War in Ukraine
item.description: As President Emmanuel Macron of France visited China, its leader, Xi Jinping, said his country would play a constructive role in ending the fighting.
item.dc:creator: Vivian Wang
item.media:description: President Emmanuel Macron of France with Xi Jinping, China’s leader, in Beijing on Thursday. Mr. Macron was welcomed with a red carpet and honor guard.

item.title: Amid Russian Sabotage, U.K. Points Finger at Putin Over Novichok Death
item.description: A British woman died from exposure to a nerve agent because of a botched assassination plot that the Russian leader must have authorized, an official report found.
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Dearden and Michael Schwirtz
item.media:description: A police cordon around the residential area where Dawn Sturgess was exposed to the Novichok nerve agent in Salisbury, England, in 2018.

item.title: What to Know About Putin’s Visit to India as Oil Trade Dries Up
item.description: The Trump administration, which crippled Russia’s oil sales to India with sanctions, will be watching Mr. Putin’s talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
item.dc:creator: Anupreeta Das and Valerie Hopkins
item.media:credit: Grigory Sysoyev/Agence France-Presse, via Pool/Afp Via Getty Images
item.media:description: In this photo released by Russian state media, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi greets President Vladimir V. Putin in New Delhi, where he arrived on Thursday.

item.title: Eurovision Is in Turmoil as Israel’s Participation Leads to Boycott
item.description: The Netherlands and Slovenia also said they would not take part in next year’s contest, meant to be its celebratory 70th edition.
item.dc:creator: Alex Marshall
item.media:description: Yuval Raphael, Israel’s 2025 Eurovision act, performing in May. The country has won the contest four times.

item.title: The One Child Policy’s Legacy: A Surplus of Single Men
item.description: A decade after the end of the one-child policy, China has over 30 million so-called surplus men. Can this dating boot camp help them find love?
item.dc:creator: Violet Du Feng

item.title: Avocado Prices Keep Going Up. Blame Narcoinflation.
item.description: Cartel extortion is pushing up prices in Mexico — and becoming a political problem President Claudia Sheinbaum can’t ignore.
item.dc:creator: Ioan Grillo
item.media:description: An avocado tree in Michoacán, Mexico, June 2024. The state, which supplies most avocados destined for the United States, has been the site of rising cartel violence.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Thanks Trump for Google Superstardom in 2025
item.description: The host said he wouldn’t have been the third-most-trending person in Google searches this year “without the support of loyal viewers” like the president.
item.dc:creator: Trish Bendix
item.category: The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (TV Program)
Late Show with Stephen Colbert (TV Program)

item.title: Stellantis Is in Default for Moving Jeep Production to U.S., Canada Says
item.description: The automaker switched production from Ontario in a bid to please President Trump. But the company defaulted on contracts covering hundreds of millions of dollars in assistance, Canada said.
item.dc:creator: Ian Austen and Matina Stevis-Gridneff
item.media:credit: Ian Willms for The New York Times
item.media:description: Stellantis’s plant in Brampton, Canada. The European-based automaker also produces vehicles under the Chrysler, Dodge and Ram brands in North America.

item.title: Yemen’s Civil War Could Escalate Again. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: An armed group backed by the United Arab Emirates has pushed into the oil-rich province of Hadramout, a move that could reignite conflict in Yemen after years of a stalemate.
item.dc:creator: Ismaeel Naar and Vivian Nereim
item.media:description: Forces loyal to the Southern Transitional Council during clashes with pro-government forces in Abyan province, Yemen, in 2020.

item.title: Human Remains Found Buried at San Diego Home
item.description: Prosecutors are looking at potential connections to a former resident, who faces a murder charge in another case.
item.dc:creator: Jill Cowan
item.media:description: Law enforcement personnel carrying out a search warrant on a San Diego home this week found human remains on the property.

item.title: Biden to Attend First Event for Presidential Library
item.description: His plans for the library have been slow to take shape, but he has invited potential donors to a holiday reception in Washington this month.
item.dc:creator: Shane Goldmacher and David A. Fahrenthold
item.media:credit: Christopher Smith for The New York Times
item.media:description: Former President Joseph R. Biden Jr. appeared at a gala for the Nebraska Democratic Party last month in Omaha.
